intro: Tetrathyrium simaoense, commonly known as the Simao mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of China, particularly in Yunnan Province, where it grows on the branches of various host trees. This plant has a unique structure with a short, woody stem and small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences and are typically white or pale green in color. Tetrathyrium simaoense plays an important ecological role by contributing to the biodiversity of its forest ecosystems.
